name: smokestack-watch
description: Re-run tests on file change with watchify and smokestack

scripts.note1: we can't have nice things. prepublish also runs on npm install https://github.com/npm/npm/issues/6394 in-publish hacks around this
scripts.prepublish: in-publish && npm prune && npm run gitPush || in-install
scripts.note2: eslint will always pull from the global eslintrc file, disable that so that we're only looking at the local
scripts.note3: travis doesn't play nicely with !#/bin/bash in the script file, so we have to explicitly set bash
scripts.dmn: dmn gen -f . && if [[ $(git diff --shortstat 2> /dev/null | tail -n1) != '' ]]; then git add .npmignore && git commit --no-verify -m'update npmignore'; fi
scripts.doctoc: doctoc README.md && if [ -f CONTRIBUTING.md ]; then doctoc CONTRIBUTING.md; fi && if [[ $(git diff --shortstat 2> /dev/null | tail -n1) != '' ]]; then git add README.md CONTRIBUTING.md && git commit --no-verify -m'table of contents update'; fi
scripts.release: source ./scripts.sh && npm run requireGitClean && npm run gitPull && npm run dmn && npm run doctoc && npm run lint && npm test && npm_release $@

config.notes: important to correct the path of npm so that the git hook doesn't error

ghooks.pre-push: PATH=$PATH:/usr/local/bin:/usr/local/sbin && npm run dmn && npm run doctoc && npm run lint && npm test
